intro: Cynoglossum sylvaticum, commonly known as the wood hound's tongue, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, lance-shaped leaves and striking blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in woodland areas and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments, and its bloom period occurs during late summer to early autumn. Cynoglossum sylvaticum is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used historically in herbal remedies.
